name: Pizza Margherita
ingredients: pizza dough, fresh mozzarella cheese, tomato sauce, fresh basil leaves, olive oil
steps:
At least 30 minutes before you plan to bake your pizza, preheat the oven to 450° Fahrenheit (232°C). If you have one, place a pizza steel or pizza stone into the oven before preheating. Personally, we use a higher temperature, see the tips section for our thoughts on what temperature is best for baking pizza at home.

If your pizza dough is cold, allow it to warm at room temperature for 20 to 30 minutes.

While the oven preheats, make the sauce. In a bowl, crush the tomatoes with the olive oil and a pinch of salt. Taste, and then season with more salt as necessary.


When ready to bake your pizza, prepare a pizza peel or pizza pan by dusting it with semolina flour.

Dust a clean work surface with all-purpose flour, and then form your pizza dough into a round, large enough to fit your pizza peel or pan. To stretch the dough, avoid rolling it out, as this can flatten the bubbles that have formed. Instead, use your fingers to make dimples in the dough, starting from the center and working outwards. Carefully stretch and push the dough to fit your pizza pan or peel. Use a light touch to maintain as many air pockets in the dough as possible.

Transfer the dough round to your pizza peel or pan, and reform it if it shrinks back a bit.

Spread a light layer of pizza sauce over the pizza, leaving a thin edge untouched for the crust. Scatter the cheese and basil over the sauce.

Bake until the crust is set and golden brown and the cheese has melted with golden spots all over, 6 to 15 minutes, depending on oven temperature. Remove from the oven, scatter over some more fresh basil, cut, and serve.

name: Pizza Hawaii
ingredients:
1 lb pizza dough (homemade or store-bought)
1 tbsp olive oil
1/2 cup pizza sauce
Cornmeal (for the pizza pan/stone) 

1.5 - 2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese
1/2 cup cooked ham or Canadian bacon, diced or sliced
1/2 cup pineapple chunks (fresh or canned, well-drained)
Optional: 3-4 slices bacon, cooked and crumbled (for extra smoky flavor)
Optional: Red pepper flakes or dried oregano
steps:
Preheat Oven: Preheat your oven to its highest setting, usually between 450°F - 500°F (230°C - 260°C). If using a pizza stone, place it in the oven while it heats.
Prepare Dough: On a lightly floured surface, roll or stretch the pizza dough into a 12-inch circle.
Assemble: Transfer the dough to a pizza pan or peel sprinkled with cornmeal. Spread the pizza sauce evenly, leaving a 1-inch border for the crust.
Add Toppings: Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese, then top with ham, pineapple, and optional bacon.
Bake: Bake for 10-15 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is bubbly and slightly charred.
Serve: Let the pizza rest for 5 minutes before slicing.

name: Caesar Salad
ingredients:
romaine lettuce
parmesan cheese
croutons
Caesar dressing
lemon juice
black pepper
garlic
anchovies
olive oil
steps:
Wash and chop romaine lettuce into bite-sized pieces
Toast bread cubes with olive oil and garlic to make croutons
Grate fresh parmesan cheese
Mix Caesar dressing with lemon juice
Toss lettuce with dressing
Top with croutons and parmesan
Add freshly ground black pepper
Serve immediately

name: Tomato Basil Soup
ingredients:
fresh tomatoes
onion
garlic
fresh basil
vegetable broth
heavy cream
olive oil
salt
pepper
sugar
steps:
Dice onions and mince garlic
Heat olive oil in a large pot
Sauté onions until translucent
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute
Add chopped tomatoes and vegetable broth
Simmer for 20 minutes
Add fresh basil leaves
Blend until smooth using immersion blender
Stir in heavy cream
Season with salt, pepper, and a pinch of sugar
Serve hot with fresh basil on top
